UseCase1.title: Mandatory fields for Login page
UseCase1.description: This use case checks what are mandatory fields on the Login page.
UseCase1.expectedResult: The error messages for required fields email and password should appear.

steps.text: Precondition: User is on 'Login' page.
Click on 'Submit' button.
Confirm that error message for email field and password is shown.

steps.text: Precondition: User is on Use Cases page.

UseCase3.title: Adding new automated Use Case
UseCase3.description: This use case checks if the user can successfully add new automated use case.
UseCase3.expectedResult: The user successfully adds automated use case and newly added test case is shown in Use cases list.

steps.text: Precondition: User is on Use Cases page.
Click on 'Create use case' button .
Populate title field with valid input.
Populate description field with valid input.
Populate expected result with valid input.
Populate one step with valid input.
Click on 'Automated' slider/switch .
Click on 'Submit' button.
Confirm that user is on the User Cases page and the newly created use case is shown in use cases list..

UseCase4.title: Change use case from not automated to automated
UseCase4.description: This use case checks if user can change use case from not automated to automated.
UseCase4.expectedResult: On the use cases page the edited use case has automated icon next to title. On the Playground card the number of automated tests changes for +1

steps.text: Precondition: User has created non automated use case.
Navigate to the use cases list and click on the use case from precondition.
On the Edit use case page click on the 'Automated' slider. Confirm that Automated is set to Yes.
Click on 'Submit' button.
Confirm that on the use cases list page next to the title of use case from preconition the automated icon is shown.
Click on Sandbox tab in header and confirm that on Playground card the number of automated tests changes for +1.
